Package Game.Board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Board.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Game
    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a 6x6 board that contains four 3x3 squares. Contains methods for board manipulation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> freeCoordinates  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Creates a new board dnd stores four squares in a squares[] array.

    • Field Detail

      • freeCoordinates

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> freeCoordinates

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Creates a new board dnd stores four squares in a squares[] array. Each square represents 1/4 of the board, and contains 3x3 grid. The board contains 4 squares, making the grid 6x6.

    • Method Detail

      • getSquare

        public Square getSquare​(int squareNr)
        Public getter method to return a particular square.
        Parameters:
        squareNr - a square number between 0-3
        Returns:
        squares[squareNr]
        Requires
        squareNr >= 0, squareNr <= 3
        Ensures
        Square != null

      • getSquares

        public Square[] getSquares()
        Method that returns the array with all the squares in it.
        Returns:
        squares[]

      • move

        public boolean move​(Move move)
        Performs the move on the board, and rotates the tile.
        Parameters:
        move - actual move to be performed on the board
        Returns:
        boolean return true if the method uses valid coordinates, returns false if the spot is occupied by a BLACK or WHITE spot
        Requires
        move != null

      • detectIfWin

        public Spot detectIfWin​(Game game)
        Performs a check on the board searching for all potential winning combinations. Will return the color that has the winning position WIll return null if no winning positions
        Parameters:
        game - currently played game
        Returns:
        true if any winning alignment on the board is present, else return false
        Ensures
        \result.equals(Spot.BLACK) || \result.equals(Spot.WHITE)

      • detectIfTie

        public boolean detectIfTie()
        Performs a check on the board and checks if there is a tie. Will return true if there are no free coordinates Will return false if there are still free coordinates
        Returns:
        true if board is full, false is board is not full

      • shift

        public Coordinates shift​(Square square,
                         Coordinates coordinates)
        Performs an appropriate coordinate shift depending on the square number between 0-3. E.g. if the square is 1, then shift the x coordinates by -3, since it is the top-right one
        Parameters:
        square - currently used square
        coordinates - x,y pair
        Returns:
        translated coordinates
        Ensures
        square != null, coordinates != null

      • getBoardCoordinates

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> getBoardCoordinates()
        Method that returns a list of all the board coordinates. Returns all 36 coordinates
        Returns:
        coordinates - a list with all board coordinates
        Ensures
        coordinates != null

      • checkIfEmpty

        public boolean checkIfEmpty​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Checks if the given coordinate contains a Spot.EMPTY. Return true if the coordinate on the board contains Spot.EMPTY Return false if the coordinate on the board doesn't contain Spot.EMPTY
        Parameters:
        coordinates - x,y pair
        Returns:
        isEmpty boolean value
        Requires
        coordinates != null
        Ensures
        isEmpty == true || isEmpty == false

      • getSquareWithCoordinates

        public Square getSquareWithCoordinates​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Method that returns the appropriate square with the current coordinates. The method can return either Square[0] top-left square or Square[1] top-right square or Square[2] bottom-left square or Square[3] bottom-right square
        Parameters:
        coordinates - x,y pair
        Returns:
        square from the squares[] array
        Requires
        coordinates != null
        Ensures
        square != null

      • getSquareNumber

        public int getSquareNumber​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Method that returns the correct square number with the current coordinates. The method can return either 0,1,2,3
        Parameters:
        coordinates - x,y pair
        Returns:
        squareNumber of the square on the board
        Requires
        coordinates != null
        Ensures
        squareNumber >= 0, squareNumber <= 3

      • getSpot

        public Spot getSpot​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Method that returns the current spot on the board from provided coordinates. The method is used to determine whether the spot is either WHITE or BLACK
        Parameters:
        coordinates - x,y pair
        Returns:
        the spot set on provided cooridnates
        Requires
        coordinates != null
        Ensures
        spot == Spot.WHITE || spot == Spot.BLACK

      • getFreeCoordinates

        public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> getFreeCoordinates()
        Returns a list with all remaining coordinates that contain Spot.EMPTY.
        Returns:
        freeCoordinates a list of all free coordinates from current board
        Ensures
        freeCoordinates != null

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method that prints the current representation of the 6x6 board with all the Spots on it.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        board with all the already set values on it
        Ensures
        board != null, board.contains("|") == true, board.contains("-") == true
